content:
Diagnosis:		Salivary duct carcinoma, parotid gland

Stage:		T4aN0M1 (Stage IVA), HER2 positive

Treatment:		Right total parotidectomy March 2023
		Adjuvant radiotherapy completed June 2023
		Palliative Trastuzumab/Docetaxel from August 2023

Current Status:	Cycle 6 review

[redacted name] attended for review prior to cycle 6 Trastuzumab/Docetaxel. Latest CT chest 15/12/23 shows stable disease with no change in the three pulmonary metastases (largest 2.1cm right lower lobe). Blood results are satisfactory for treatment continuation. She reports grade 2 peripheral neuropathy affecting fingers and toes, but wishes to continue current doses given disease control. Performance status remains 1. No new symptoms. Examination shows well-healed right parotid surgical site with no evidence of local recurrence. Plan to proceed with cycle 6 today and arrange repeat CT chest/abdomen/pelvis prior to cycle 8 review. Will see again in 3 weeks with blood results.

primary_cancer.metastases: pulmonary metastases, largest 2.1cm right lower lobe

cancer_timeline.value: CT chest shows stable disease with three pulmonary metastases, largest 2.1cm right lower lobe

patient_facts.value: Grade 2 peripheral neuropathy affecting fingers and toes
Well-healed right parotid surgical site with no evidence of local recurrence

status_updates.value: HER2 positive metastatic salivary duct carcinoma with stable pulmonary metastases on Trastuzumab/Docetaxel
Grade 2 peripheral neuropathy affecting fingers and toes
Review in 3 weeks with blood results
